title: Harbin International Convention Exhibition and Sports Center
text:
The Harbin International Conference Exhibition and Sports Center () is a <a href="convention%20center">convention center</a> for <a href="Harbin">Harbin</a>, <a href="China">China</a>. It hosts various conventions. It has also hosted the <a href="2007%20Cup%20of%20China">2007 Cup of China</a> <a href="figure%20skating">figure skating</a> competition and hosted events for <a href="1996%20Asian%20Winter%20Games">1996 Asian Winter Games</a> and <a href="2009%20Winter%20Universiade">2009 Winter Universiade</a>. The facility has a floor space of 63,000 square meters (about 700,000 square feet). It is home to a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> with a seating capacity of 48,000 spectators and a 10,603-seated gymnasium.
Stadium.
The Harbin International Convention and Exhibition Centre Stadium is a multi-purpose stadium and is the main venue of the convention center. It is currently used mostly for <a href="association%20football">football</a> matches. The stadium has a seating capacity of 48,000 spectators.
Gymnasium.
Harbin International Conference Exhibition and Sports Center Gymnasium is an <a href="indoor%20arena">indoor sporting arena</a> located at the convention centre. The capacity of the arena is 10,603 spectators. It hosts indoor sporting events such as <a href="basketball">basketball</a> and <a href="volleyball">volleyball</a>, and also hosted the indoor events of the <a href="2009%20Winter%20Universiade">2009 Winter Universiade</a>.
